question: Which Indian-origin boy has been crowned as the UK's 'Child Genius' in a popular television quiz competition?
explanation: Rahul Doshi (12), an Indian-origin boy, has been crowned as the UK\'s \'Child Genius\' in a popular television quiz competition, after answering all questions correctly. He won the Channel 4 show \'Child Genius\' by beating his nine-year-old opponent - Ronan by 10-4 in the programme\'s finale on August 20, 2017. In the final, Rahul impressed with knowledge of his chosen subject - Edward Jenner\'s medical innovation and methodology in 18th Century England. He clinched the title by answering a question on 19th Century artists William Holman Hunt and John Everett Millais. He has an IQ of 162, which is believed to be higher than the likes of Albert Einstein and Stephen Hawking, and qualifies him to be a member of Mensa club - the largest and oldest high IQ society in the world.
